page.title: 16INDUSTRY IN THE AREA (part2)
page.content: .With the development of man made fibres and cheap imported textiles the woollen trade went into decline. Old mills were often taken over by the expanding engineering industry "British Cotton Spinners" became "Fletcher Filtration".Some mills were used by several firms as happened at premises owned by "Lyles Ltd." Other mill buildings have had several uses and are now used by many very small firms as happened at the "Low Mills" which were owned by "Lee Nephew and Sons Ltd." These old premises built on the island formed by the river and the canal are used by a cricket bat maker,a sheet metal worker,a joiner,a motor mechanic, a builder,a painter,a textile waste firm,a caravan servicing firm,a waste paper merchant,2 firms of joiners and builders,an upholsterer plus several more firms.
